alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued August 24 at 10:05AM AKDT until August 25 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM AKDT FRIDAY... The National Weather Service in Anchorage has issued a High Surf Advisory, which is in effect from 4 PM this afternoon to 10 AM AKDT Friday. * LOCATION...South and West facing shores along Kuskokwim Bay. * WAVES AND SURF...Water levels are expected to rise during high tides, 2 to 5 feet above normal highest tide. * TIMING...Until 10 AM AKDT Friday morning. Locations from Kipnuk west can experience two tidal peaks above normal highest tide, the first Friday evening and the second early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...South to southwesterly gale force winds with gusts of 45 to 55 mph from a strong storm system moving northeast from St. George Island to Toksook Bay. The resulting higher seas and surf, coinciding with high tide, will raise the potential for rough surf and coastal erosion for south and west facing communities along Kuskokwim Bay.
info.instruction: A high surf advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing rip currents and localized beach erosion.
